attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 1 April 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Stock controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Minimal variances is noted in most of the stock items is an indication that stock controls are effective.

value: To be maintained.
We will maintain.
A variance of +109 loaves and -174 pcs of polybags was noted in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 1% and 400g W- 01%.

                 The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Effective weight controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Few cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are adhered to.

value: We will continue making improvements.
More control measures will be initiated.
All samples of packed bread had the correct weight in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 16.02.25 – 31.03.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the acceptable limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 921.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.16% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,222.5 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.19% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The effective controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
To be maintained.
Market damages slightly exceeded the set limit by 68 loaves in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis
attributes.description:
·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 16.02.25 – 31.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·        No significant variance in bread posting noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.
attributes.effect: Production standards were observed.

value: We will maintain
To be maintained
No variances were noted in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        Production efficiency were analyzed from 16.02.25 – 31.03.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·        The branch hired a total of 650 workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,925 bags.

·        The actual production was 2,975 bags leading to a production shortfall of 18 bags and the actual efficiency was 4.58 bags per worker.

Production efficiency

Implication

The set efficiency was attained indicating that the planned labour cost was observed.
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to ensure that proper planning of production workers is done to ensure that the set production efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was attained indicating that the planned labour cost was observed.

value: The positive trend will be maintained
The positive trend will be maintained
Production efficiency was achieved in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: To be maintained.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Minishop spot-checks
attributes.description:
·        Spot checks was done on the branch minishops; Changamwe, Aldina, Migadini, Mikindani and Magongo to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

·        No material variances were noted during the spot-checks.
attributes.recommendation: The branch to continue following Minishop management SOPs.
attributes.effect: Minishops are run as per the company SOPs.

value: We will maintain the trend.
Minishop SOPs will always be observed.
No material variances were noted in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Generator fuel analysis
attributes.description:
·        Review of generator records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        The average rate of fuel usage was 11.0 Ltrs per hour which is within the range.

·        

              Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Efficient use of generator fuel should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Minishops are run as per the company SOPs.

value: We will maintain.
Proper controls will be maintained.
No previous audit findings
